member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.FrameType.PFrame
member.summary: P‑frames can use data from previous frames to decompress and are more compressible than I‑frames.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.FrameType.IFrame
member.summary: I‑frames are the least compressible but don't require other video frames to decode.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.FrameType.BFrame
member.summary: B‑frames can use both previous and forward frames for data reference to get the highest amount of data compression.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.FrameType.MJpeg
member.summary: In multimedia, Motion JPEG (M-JPEG or MJPEG) is a video compression format in which each video frame or interlaced field of a digital video sequence is compressed separately as a JPEG image.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Media.Channel
member.summary: channel of the media, start by 0.

member.summary: stream of the media, start by 0.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Media.Begin
member.summary: begin time. MUST be existed when mode is playback, See time format.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Media.End
member.summary: end time. MUST be existed when mode is playback, See time format.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Video.BitrateType
member.summary: bit control of the video. cbr or vbr.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Video.Bitrate
member.summary: bit rate of the video. Unit is in Kbits per second.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Video.GOP
member.summary: gop of the video. Gop means the how many frames between the current KeyFrames and Next KeyFrames

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Video.Codec
member.summary: codec of the video. like "h264" or "mjpeg" and so on

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Audio.Samples
member.summary: sample rate of the audio. Unit is in HZ

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Audio.Codec
member.summary: codec of the audio. like “g.711u”,”g.711a”,”aac”,”adpcm_ima_wav” and so on

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.PushHeader.FrameType

member.summary: Flag of infrared device, 1: Infrared camera, 0: general camera.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoStandard.PAL
member.summary: Phase Alternating Line (PAL) is a colour encoding system for analogue television used in broadcast television systems in most countries broadcasting at 625-line / 50 field (25 frame) per second (576i). Other common colour encoding systems are NTSC and SECAM. This page primarily discusses the PAL colour encoding system. The articles on broadcast television systems and analogue television further describe frame rates, image resolution and audio modulation.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoStandard.NTSC
member.summary: NTSC, named after the National Television System Committee, is the analog television system that was used in most of the Americas.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.RotationDegree
member.summary: Video rotation degree, in some situation your camera will be installed upside down. So you can use this parameter to revise video. 180 means upside down. Range from 0 to 360. [0,360]

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.Brightness
member.summary: Brightness before encoding. Range is 0 to 255.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.Contrast
member.summary: Contrast before encoding. Range is 0 to 255.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.Saturation
member.summary: Saturation before encoding. Range is 0 to 255.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.Hue
member.summary: Hue before encoding. Range is 0 to 255.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.VideoParam.Infrared
member.summary: Whether to turn on the day and night switching functions.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.RecordedFile.BeginTime
member.summary: Beginning utc time of recorded file.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.RecordedFile.EndTime
member.summary: Ending utc time of recorded file.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.RecordedFileList.RecordedFile
member.summary: Current page recorded file information array.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.RateType.CBR
member.summary: Constant bitrate (CBR) is a term used in telecommunications, relating to the quality of service.

member.name: F:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.RateType.VBR
member.summary: Variable bitrate (VBR) is a term used in telecommunications and computing that relates to the bitrate used in sound or video encoding. As opposed to constant bitrate (CBR), VBR files vary the amount of output data per time segment.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.CodingParam.FrameRate
member.summary: Number of frame per second, range is 1 to 30. [1,30]

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.CodingParam.BitRate
member.summary: The number of kilo bits per second(Kbps).

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.CodingParam.ImageQuality
member.summary: Image quality is a characteristic of an image that measures the perceived image degradation (typically, compared to an ideal or perfect image). Imaging systems may introduce some amounts of distortion or artifacts in the signal, so the quality assessment is an important problem. 0 is worst, 100 is best.[0,100]

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.CodingParam.AudioInput
member.summary: Whether the audio data is included in the transmission and recoding.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.AlarmLinkageParam.PreRecordingTime
member.summary: Alarm pre-recording seconds, range from 0 second to 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.AlarmLinkageParam.PostRecordingTime
member.summary: Alarm post-recording seconds. at least 30 seconds.

member.summary: Client unsubscribe media stream command request message payload struct.

member.summary: Hostname or ip address of media turn server.

member.summary: Invitation mode.Let pu know live or playback stream you want.

member.summary: The begin utc time of recording file stream, only in playback mode.

member.summary: The end utc time of recording file stream, only in playback mode.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.AuxiliaryStatus.AuxiliaryType

member.summary: unique identifier of client session. Get from CONNACK.

member.summary: topic of this subscribe. Now supports “media” only.

member.summary: Dialog id of the media invitation

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.DeviceId
member.summary: The Id of the camera which the client wants to invite.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.Mode
member.summary: mode of media stream, live or playback.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.Channel
member.summary: channel of the media, start by 0.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.Stream
member.summary: stream of the media, start by 0. 0 - main stream, 1- sub stream.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.BeginTime
member.summary: begin time. MUST be existed when mode is playback

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.EndTime
member.summary: begin time. MUST be existed when mode is playback

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.MEDIAMETA.KeyFrameIndex
member.summary: need index of key_frame or not, only avaliable when mode is playack

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.VIDEO.Resolution
member.summary: resolution of the video. array[0] is width, array[1] is height

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.VIDEO.BitrateType
member.summary: bit control of the video. “cbr” or “vbr”

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.VIDEO.Bitrate
member.summary: bit rate of the video. Unit is in Kbits per second.

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.VIDEO.GOP
member.summary: gop of the video. Gop means the how many frames between the current KeyFrames and Next KeyFrames

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.VIDEO.Codec
member.summary: codec of the video. like “h264” or “mjpeg” and so on

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.AUDIO.Samples
member.summary: sample rate of the audio. Unit is in HZ

member.name: P:Howell.eCamera.Middlewares.Medium.AUDIO.Codec
member.summary: codec of the audio. like “g.711u”,”g.711a”,”aac”,”adpcm_ima_wav” and so on

member.summary: Client subscribe media stream command response message payload struct.

member.summary: topic of this subscribe. Now supports “media” only.
